newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-BROWN WINS DEPOSIT GUARANTY GOLF CLASSIC.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-BROWN WINS DEPOSIT GUARANTY GOLF CLASSIC.

text.p: Billy Ray Brown, playing with "a sense of urgency" after losing his PGA Tour privileges last year, shot a 5-under-par 67 Sunday to win the $1 million Deposit Guaranty Golf Classic.
A birdie on the par-5, 532-yard 18th hole enabled Brown to edge his former University of Houston teammate, Mike Standly, by one stroke.

"I answered a lot of questions about myself with my performance out there today," said Brown, who had to go back to the PGA Tour qualifying school last fall to regain his tour exemption. "I can't tell you how much this means to me. I promise you that right now I'm as happy about winning here as Justin Leonard is about winning the British Open.

Brown had a four-round total of 17-under 271 on the Jack Nicklaus-designed Annandale Golf Club course. The victory was his first since the 1992 Byron Nelson Classic and, after earning only $39,000 this year, Brown picked up $180,000. He also earned a two-year PGA Tour exemption.
"This is by far the biggest win of my career," Brown said. "I don't mean to make light of the others, but this one, because of the circumstances, means the most to me."

Standly put up a strong challenge with a final-round 66, leaving him at 272. Mike Brisky had a 68 to finish third at 273, while third-round leader Steve Jurgensen faded to a 72, dropping him into a six-way tie for fourth at 274.
